CatDescriptText: Mercedes Nickens, Cochrandale Projects, Duquesne, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 24, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the increasing demand for father and mother to work, thus taking both parents out of the home for the better part of the day, affects their children as regards discipline, ambition, and social compatibility in general?" answer reads: "I might say that a babysitter or relatives will never take the place of the parents.  Therefore, I say that it is better for either of the two parents to be present in home with the children."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mercedes Nickens wearing light colored hat, earrings, light colored coat with star shaped brooch, and dark gloves, standing with arms crossed on sidewalk in front of building with store windows on either side, one on left with clock, and one on right with sign that reads "Coats"
